11.text: No. SEBI/LAD-NRO/GN/2018/39. - In exercise of the powers conferred by section 30 read with sub-section (1) of section 11 and section 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 (15 of 1992), section 23JB of the Securities Contracts (Regulations) Act, 1956 and section 19-IB of the Depositories Act, 1996, the Board hereby makes the following regulations, namely,-
nounChunks: 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
exercise of the powers conferred by section 30
section 11 and section 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992

15.text: These regulations may be called the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Appointment of Administrator and Procedure for Refunding to the Investors) Regulations, 2018.
ents: Securities and Exchange Board of India
nounChunks: (Appointment of Administrator and Procedure for Refunding to the Investors) Regulations, 2018.

16.text: They shall come into force on the date of their notification in the Official Gazette.

18.text: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires,-

19.text: a)“Act” means the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 [15 of 1992];
ents: Securities and Exchange Board of India

21.text: b)“Administrator” means a person registered with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India as an Insolvency Resolution Professional and who has been engaged by the Recovery Officer for the purposes of these regulations.

27.text: f)"certificate" means the statement drawn up by the Recovery Officer under section 28A of the Act or section 23JB of the Securities Contracts (Regulations) Act, 1956 or section 19-IB of the Depositories Act, 1996 and shall not include a sale certificate;

28.text: g)"defaulter" for the purposes of these regulations, means a person who has failed to comply with an order of the Board to refund monies to the investors or an order of the Board for disgorgement within the specified time period and who is mentioned as a defaulter in the certificate;

30.text: i)“e-auction agency” means a company providing an e-auction platform which is engaged by the Administrator for the purposes of auctioning and selling properties attached by the Recovery Officer;

31.text: j)“investor” means the person, whether identified or not, in whose favour the refund of monies had been directed by the Board;

32.text: k)"property" means and includes assets of any kind, whether movable or immovable, tangible or intangible, corporeal or incorporeal and includes securities, bank accounts, deposits, any right or interest or legal documents or instruments evidencing title to or interest in the property and where the property is capable of conversion into some other form, then the property in the converted form and also includes the proceeds from the property.

41.text: These regulations shall be applicable for all or any of the following:

42.text: appointment of Administrator pursuant to failure to comply with disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board;
nounChunks: disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board
failure to comply with disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board

43.text: sale of properties attached by the Recovery Officer of the Board under the Act;
nounChunks: properties attached by the Recovery Officer of the Board under the Act
sale of properties attached by the Recovery Officer of the Board under the Act;
the Recovery Officer of the Board

44.text: collection of claim documents and verification of claims of investors for the purpose of effecting refunds;
nounChunks: collection of claim documents and verification of claims of investors for the purpose of effecting refunds;
claim documents and verification of claims of investors for the purpose of effecting refunds

45.text: refund of monies to the investors pursuant to disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board;
nounChunks: refund of monies to the investors
disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board

46.text: recovery of disgorgement amounts directed by the Board;
nounChunks: recovery of disgorgement amounts directed by the Board;
disgorgement amounts directed by the Board

47.text: any act incidental or connected thereto.
nounChunks: any act incidental or connected thereto
any act incidental or connected thereto.

48.text: Unless otherwise specifically ordered, these regulations shall not be applicable to cases where the Securities Appellate Tribunal or a Court has appointed an administrator or any other person for the purposes of recovery and/or repayment to investors.
nounChunks: cases where the Securities Appellate Tribunal or a Court has appointed an administrator or any other person for the purposes of recovery and/or repayment to investors
an administrator or any other person
the Securities Appellate Tribunal or a Court

50.text: The provisions of these regulations shall apply mutatis mutandis in respect of the proceedings under the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 or the Depositories Act, 1996.
nounChunks: the proceedings under the Securities Contracts (Regulation
respect of the proceedings under the Securities Contracts (Regulation

54.text: For the purposes of these regulations, the Board shall, after attachment of the properties of the defaulter by the Recovery Officer, appoint an Administrator in the manner specified.
nounChunks: the properties of the defaulter by the Recovery Officer
attachment of the properties of the defaulter by the Recovery Officer

55.text: Eligibility norms for appointment as an Administrator.
nounChunks: Eligibility norms for appointment as an Administrator.

56.text: The Administrator shall be a person registered with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India as an Insolvency Resolution Professional and empanelled by the Board from time to time.
nounChunks: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
a person registered with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
cleanedUpEnts: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India

57.text: No person shall be appointed as an Administrator where such an appointment may be objected to on the grounds that give rise to justifiable doubts as to the independence or impartiality of such a person:
nounChunks: the independence or impartiality of such a person
the grounds that give rise to justifiable doubts as to the independence or impartiality of such a person
an Administrator where such an appointment may be objected to on the grounds that give rise to justifiable doubts as to the independence or impartiality of such a person

58.text: Provided that any question involving issues of conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator shall be decided by the Recovery Officer.
nounChunks: issues of conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator
any question involving issues of conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator

59.text: The Administrator shall provide an undertaking to the Board of absence of any conflict of interest with the defaulter, its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities.
nounChunks: its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities
any conflict of interest with the defaulter, its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities

60.text: The Administrator shall also forthwith disclose to the Board any conflict of interest which may come to his knowledge during his tenure:
nounChunks: any conflict of interest which may come to his knowledge during his tenure

61.text: For the purposes of these regulations, the Administrator shall be deemed to be a public servant within the meaning of section 21 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860) and sections 22 and 23 of the Act shall accordingly apply to him.
nounChunks: section 21 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)
the meaning of section 21 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)

63.text: The terms and conditions of appointment including remuneration shall be specified by the Board, on a case to case basis, after taking into consideration the quantum of work, the number of investors and the quantum of money involved.
nounChunks: The terms and conditions of appointment including remuneration shall be specified by the Board, on a case to case basis, after taking into consideration the quantum of work, the number of investors and the quantum of money involved

65.text: Part II - Functions of the Administrator
nounChunks: Part II - Functions of the Administrator

66.text: An Administrator shall perform the following functions –

67.text: As may be directed by the Recovery Officer, obtain from the defaulter or any other person, any information or document including documents relating to ownership and possession of properties, details of amount raised from investors, claims of investors, amount claimed to have been refunded to investors;
nounChunks: the defaulter or any other person, any information or document including documents relating to ownership and possession of properties
documents relating to ownership and possession of properties
any information or document including documents relating to ownership and possession of properties

68.text: Make a record of the properties that have been attached by the Recovery Officer including the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order;
nounChunks: the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order

a record of the properties that have been attached by the Recovery Officer including the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order

the properties that have been attached by the Recovery Officer including the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order
those properties which are not part of the attachment order

69.text: Make a record of the bank accounts and dematerialised accounts of the defaulter and value of the monies and securities held thereunder;
nounChunks: accounts of the defaulter and value of the monies and securities held thereunder
a record of the bank accounts
the defaulter and value of the monies and securities

70.text: Arrange for a proclamation for the sale of the property and arrange affixation of the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act;
nounChunks: the sale of the property and arrange affixation of the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act
accordance with the provisions of the Act
the property and arrange affixation of the copy of such proclamation
a proclamation for the sale of the property and arrange affixation of the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act

71.text: Open an interest bearing bank account, under the control of the Recovery Officer, with a scheduled public sector bank for depositing the proceeds of the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors;
nounChunks: a scheduled public sector bank for depositing the proceeds of the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors
the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors
the proceeds of the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors
the control of the Recovery Officer

72.text: Sell the attached properties in accordance with these regulations or as may be directed by the Recovery Officer;

73.text: Call for claims, in the manner specified in these regulations or as may be directed by the Recovery Officer, for the purposes of repayment to investors, pursuant to an order of the Board for refunds;
nounChunks: an order of the Board for refunds
the purposes of repayment to investors

74.text: Verify the claims of investors and also that of the defaulter in respect of repayment of monies, either partly paid or wholly paid, claimed to have been made to investors on the basis of documentary evidence:
nounChunks: the defaulter in respect of repayment of monies

75.text: Explanation – Verification may involve forensic auditing.

76.text: Carry out any other necessary incidental and supplementary act, with the prior approval of the Recovery Officer that may be required for the purpose of carrying out its obligations under these regulations.
nounChunks: any other necessary incidental and supplementary act
the purpose of carrying out its obligations under these regulations
the prior approval of the Recovery Officer that may be required for the purpose of carrying out its obligations under these regulations

77.text: While discharging the functions under these regulations, the Administrator -

78.text: may engage the services of a peer reviewed chartered accountant for verifying the claims of investors on the basis of documentary evidence and for submission of a certified report to the Administrator;

82.text: Officer, for managing the entire repayment process.

83.text: Provided that the fees paid for such services shall be fixed by the Administrator taking into account the relevant factors including –
nounChunks: the fees paid for such services

84.text: the number of investors and the claims that are made;
nounChunks: the number of investors and the claims that are made;

89.text: Provided further that the intermediary or such other person engaged by the Administrator, shall not have any conflict of interest which would impede their independence or impartiality.
nounChunks: any conflict of interest which would impede their independence or impartiality

90.text: The Administrator shall submit a monthly report or a report as and when called for by the Recovery Officer on the progress of work entrusted including the monies realised pursuant to the sale of the properties and the repayments made to the investors.

92.text: The Administrator shall undertake the process of sale of properties after conducting an independent valuation of such properties by a registered valuer.
nounChunks: the process of sale of properties

93.text: After considering the valuation report, the Recovery Officer may decide on the reserve price below which the property may not be sold.
nounChunks: the reserve price below which the property may not be sold

94.text: The Administrator may undertake the sale of properties through e-auction process and for this purpose engage an e-auction agency and shall in consultation with the Recovery Officer repeat the auction process till the time such properties are disposed off.
nounChunks: the time such properties are disposed off

95.text: The process of disposing off the properties shall be under the supervision of the Recovery Officer.

98.text: The amount realized in respect of sale of properties of the defaulter shall be deposited in a separate bank account with a scheduled public sector bank in terms of clause (e) of regulation 7 and such account shall be under the control of the Recovery Officer.

101.text: For the purposes of inviting claims from the investors, the Administrator shall -
nounChunks: the purposes of inviting claims from the investors

102.text: issue advertisements in an English and a Hindi newspaper having nationwide circulation and if so directed by the Recovery Officer, issue such advertisement in vernacular newspaper(s) having circulation in the area(s) where the investors are concentrated;

104.text: The advertisement referred to sub-regulation (1) may also be hosted on the website of the Board.

105.text: The advertisements referred to in sub-regulation (1) shall contain instructions on the manner of making claims by investors and the documents and information that are to be submitted for verifying and processing their claim applications.

107.text: Provided that the investors’ claims received, if any, by the Board and forwarded to the Administrator shall also be included in the relevant records maintained by the Administrator.

108.text: The Administrator or the chartered accountant engaged by the Administrator, shall consider the total eligible claims as against the monies available for distribution to investors in order to determine whether the whole amount or a proportionate amount may be repaid to the investors as may be directed by the Recovery Officer.

110.text: The refund process shall be kept open for an appropriate period as may be decided in consultation with the Recovery Officer.

112.text: The monies remaining in the interest bearing escrow bank account after satisfying all the permissible claims of investors and other charges, shall be retained therein for a period of three years in order to meet the claims that may be received from any unpaid investor.

119.text: The cost and expenses referred to in sub-regulation (1) shall be reasonable and directly related to and necessary for the act and purposes referred to in these regulations.

120.text: Where the Administrator is appointed on the request of a person against whom an order for disgorgement or refund had been issued by the Board, the remuneration of the Administrator and the other costs incurred in respect of recovery and/or refund to the investors shall be borne by such person.

123.text: 1. The proceeds from the sale of properties of the defaulter shall be distributed in the following order of priority, namely, -
nounChunks: The proceeds from the sale of properties of the defaulter
the sale of properties of the defaulter

126.text: Provided the Board may direct the Administrator to initiate the process of refund to the investors with the monies realized at the relevant time. For this purpose, the Administrator may call for claims in tranches

127.text: any other penalty or fees due from the defaulter to the Board under the provisions of the Act, the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 or the Depositories Act, 1996.

137.text: Part VI - General obligations and responsibilities
nounChunks: Part VI - General obligations and responsibilities

140.text: a)shall maintain high standards of integrity, promptitude and fairness in the conduct of all his business.
nounChunks: high standards of integrity, promptitude and fairness in the conduct of all his business
the conduct of all his business

141.text: b)shall act with due skill, care and diligence in the conduct of all his business.
nounChunks: due skill, care and diligence in the conduct of all his business
the conduct of all his business

142.text: c)shall not misrepresent any facts or situations and shall refrain from being involved in any action that would bring disrepute to the profession.
nounChunks: any action that would bring disrepute to the profession

143.text: d)shall act with objectivity during the course of his professional dealings by ensuring that all decisions are made without any bias, conflict of interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party, whether directly or indirectly connected to sale of properties, verification of claims and refund of monies.
nounChunks: conflict of interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party
the course of his professional dealings
properties, verification of claims and refund of monies
any bias, conflict of interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party
sale of properties, verification of claims and refund of monies
verification of claims and refund of monies
interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party
coercion, or undue influence of any party

144.text: e)shall not acquire, directly or indirectly, any of the assets of the defaulter.

145.text: f)shall maintain complete independence in all professional relationships and conduct the verification and refund process, as the case may be, independent of external influences.

146.text: g)shall not conceal any material information or knowingly make a misleading statement to the Recovery Officer or the Board.
nounChunks: a misleading statement to the Recovery Officer or the Board
the Recovery Officer or the Board

147.text: h)shall not act with mala fide or be negligent while performing the functions and duties under the regulations.

148.text: i)shall provide all information and records as may be required by the Recovery Officer within the time specified by him.

149.text: j)shall ensure that confidentiality of the information relating to the sale of properties, verification and refund process, is maintained at all times: Provided that the Administrator may disclose any information after obtaining written authorization of the Recovery Officer or the Board.
nounChunks: the sale of properties, verification and refund process
the Recovery Officer or the Board
confidentiality of the information relating to the sale of properties, verification and refund process
written authorization of the Recovery Officer or the Board
the information relating to the sale of properties, verification and refund process

150.text: k)shall disclose all costs towards the verification and refund process and endeavour to ensure that such costs are not unreasonable.
nounChunks: the verification and refund process and endeavour
all costs towards the verification and refund process and endeavour

151.text: l)shall comply with the terms and conditions of its appointment.
nounChunks: the terms and conditions of its appointment
l)shall comply with the terms and conditions of its appointment.

156.text: The Recovery Officer may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, recommend for replacement of the Administrator, in case the Administrator has -

157.text: a)failed to comply with the terms and conditions of appointment;
nounChunks: the terms and conditions of appointment

158.text: b)engaged valuers or chartered accountants or such other persons who are ineligible to act so;
nounChunks: chartered accountants or such other persons who are ineligible to act so
b)engaged valuers or chartered accountants or such other persons who are ineligible to act so;

159.text: c)failed to comply with any of the obligations and responsibilities specified under these regulations;
nounChunks: the obligations and responsibilities specified under these regulations

160.text: d)acted against the instructions of the Recovery Officer or the Board; or
nounChunks: the Recovery Officer or the Board
the instructions of the Recovery Officer or the Board

161.text: e)acted in such manner that is prejudicial to the interest of the investors.

162.text: Without prejudice to the action under sub-regulation (1), the Recovery Officer may recommend for initiation of appropriate action under the Act.
nounChunks: prejudice to the action under sub-regulation (1)
initiation of appropriate action under the Act

163.text: On receipt of such recommendation or suo moto, the Board may take apprpriate action against the Administrator or such intermediary or such other person enagaged by the Administrator, under the Act including the following:
nounChunks: the Administrator or such intermediary or such other person
receipt of such recommendation or suo moto
apprpriate action against the Administrator or such intermediary or such other person enagaged by the Administrator

164.text: remove such Administrator from the Panel;

165.text: forward the matter to the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India for appropriate action against the Administrator who is an Insolvency Resolution Professional; and
nounChunks: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India

166.text: issue suitable directions restraining such person from engaging in activities in the securities market in his professional capacity.

167.text: The Board shall replace an Administrator in the event his registration with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India is cancelled or suspended.

his registration with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
